elements.title: Sundari paintings (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Sundari paintings (example pictured) were a popular type of erotic art in 19th-century British India?

elements.title: Chris Wroblewski (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Chris Wroblewski was the starting point guard for the winningest team in Ivy League history?

elements.title: 4th Congress of the Communist Party of Lithuania (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in the lead-up to the 4th Congress of the Communist Party of Lithuania in Moscow in 1924, party organizations inside Lithuania held clandestine district conferences?

elements.title: Mardani Ali Sera (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Mardani Ali Sera, after initiating a campaign to "Replace the President", prohibited himself from speaking of it after the 2019 Indonesian presidential election?

elements.title: were nominated (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that three songs from Kyla's album Not Your Ordinary Girl were nominated in the same category at the 2005 Awit Awards?

elements.title: 700 gold coins (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a man found 700 gold coins on his own land in an undisclosed part of Kentucky?

elements.title: Protect Trans Kids (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Gwen Stacy was depicted with a "Protect Trans Kids" poster in her room in Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse?

elements.title: Ed Bradley (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Ed Bradley could get interviewees to divulge information with just his body language and facial expressions?
